channel.title: Ars-Technica on Panz3r News
channel.description: Recent content in Ars-Technica on news.panz3r.dev

item.title: A “no math” (but seven-part) guide to modern quantum mechanics
item.description: Welcome to “The curious observer’s guide to quantum mechanics”–featuring particle/wave duality.

item.title: New York City proposes regulating algorithms used in hiring
item.description: Bill would require firms to disclose when they use software to assess candidates.

item.title: Amazon cuts off Parler’s Web hosting following Apple, Google bans
item.description: The app will need to find new Web hosting by Sunday or go offline.

item.title: The immune system and COVID: It’s still confusing
item.description: Antibodies may help, inflammation may hurt, but immunosuppressants are irrelevant?

item.title: What to expect from the first-ever virtual CES
item.description: Some big players are missing, along with over half of last year’s exhibitors.

item.title: Twitter takes down China’s “baby-making machines” tweet on Uighur women
item.description: Twitter now says the tweet violates a rule against dehumanizing an ethnic group.

item.title: Google bans Parler from Android app store
item.description: Mainstream social media sites have banned Donald Trump and others on the right.

item.title: Donald Trump has finally earned a permaban from Twitter
item.description: Twitter banned Trump’s account “due to the risk of further incitement of violence. "

item.title: Motorola shovels the 2021 Moto G lineup onto the market
item.description: They mostly have big batteries, no NFC, and a poor update plan.

item.title: Reddit’s largest remaining Trump community banned for “inciting violence” [Updated]
item.description: Friday ban comes with clear notice: “Do not post violent content.” Discord follows suit.

item.title: Michael Flynn and Sidney Powell banned from Twitter in QAnon purge
item.description: Flynn has called for Trump to declare martial law and hold a new election.

item.title: Dominion Voting suing “kraken” lawyer Sidney Powell for $1.3B
item.description: A company at the heart of failed suits falsely alleging voter fraud is fighting back.

item.title: FBI arrests Republican lawmaker who stormed Capitol with pro-Trump mob
item.description: W.V. lawmaker Derrick Evans charged with entering restricted area of US Capitol.

item.title: What I learned playing 30+ years’ worth of Jeopardy! video games
item.description: From the Apple II to PS4, digital Jeopardy! spans 40+ games and traces the medium’s history.

item.title: Quibi’s $1.75B experiment ends with Roku acquisition for “less than $100M”
item.description: Roku has yet to tell viewers whether they’ll need to turn their TVs sideways.

item.title: Biden plans to release full vaccine supply, reversing Trump policy
item.description: “The president-elect believes we must accelerate distribution of the vaccine.”

item.title: Ajit Pai offers mild criticism of Trump incitement, drops Section 230 plan
item.description: With Pai leaving soon, he says there’s no time to impose social-media crackdown.

item.title: A Google smart display with radar-based sleep tracking is reportedly happening
item.description: After flopping in the Pixel line, Google’s radar chips are coming to smart displays.

item.title: This is how hominins adapted to a changing world 2 million years ago
item.description: Early hominins succeeded by being generalists with basic, versatile tools.

item.title: Apple allegedly working with Hyundai on electric car for 2027
item.description: The Korea Economic Daily got confirmation of the collaboration.

item.title: Hackers can clone Google Titan 2FA keys using a side channel in NXP chips
item.description: Yubico and Feitian keys that use the same chip are likely susceptible, too.

item.title: Rocket Report: NASA ready to hot fire SLS, Roscosmos sues itself?
item.description: “We are obliged to file a lawsuit in connection with the satellite’s failure.”

item.title: Bummed about new Google Photos storage limits? Amazon Photos says “hi”
item.description: This surprisingly good photo service has flown mostly under the radar since 2014.

item.title: “Baby-making machines”: Chinese tweet on Uighurs not against Twitter rules
item.description: Twitter bans “the dehumanization of a group of people” based on ethnicity.

item.title: Anthony Mackie plays an android supersoldier in Outside the Wire trailer
item.description: Mikael Håfström directs this latest Netflix foray into action feature films.

item.title: SpaceX has launched its 50th previously flown rocket [Updated]
item.description: This launch continues the trend of SpaceX using increasingly experienced first stages.

item.title: Boeing charged with fraud over 737 Max, fined more than $2.5 billion
item.description: The Justice Department is not happy that Boeing wasn’t straight with the FAA.

item.title: Elon Musk is the world’s richest person
item.description: Musk will earn even more Tesla stock if he hits revenue and profit targets.

item.title: Samsung backtracks on $1,000 Chromebooks with cheaper Galaxy Chromebook 2
item.description: The price of Samsung’s flagship Chromebook has been nearly cut in half. It’s $549.

item.title: Insurrectionists’ social media presence gives feds an easy way to ID them
item.description: You don’t need fancy technology to identify folks who livestream their crimes.

item.title: One piece of optical hardware performs massively parallel AI calculations
item.description: Two research groups manage similar feats through very different methods.

item.title: Nerts! is the free, pleasant six-player card game we could all use right now
item.description: Zachtronics' cleverly engineered battle-solitaire twist based on the game Pounce.

item.title: How the Trump-incited mob may have caused a COVID superspreader event
item.description: Virus had lots of chances to spread through dense mob and evacuated lawmakers.

item.title: Four-point-whoa: The 2021 Porsche 718 Boxster GTS
item.description: The two-seat sports car gets the 4.0L engine from the Boxster Spyder.

item.title: Republican state lawmaker livestreamed himself in mob storming US Capitol
item.description: “Patriots inside, baby!” WV state legislator Derrick Evans yelled in Capitol.

item.title: The world’s cryptocurrency is now worth more than $1 trillion
item.description: Bitcoin’s anonymous founder, Satoshi Nakamoto, could be worth $40 billion.

item.title: At risk of extinction, black-footed ferrets get vaccinated for COVID-19
item.description: Ferrets, minks, and other Mustelinae species are susceptible to COVID-19.

item.title: Facebook, Instagram ban Trump through at least Inauguration Day
item.description: The risks of allowing Trump to remain “are simply too great,” Zuckerberg said.

item.title: Twitch removes PogChamp emote it says was “the face of… further violence”
item.description: Ryan “Gootecks” Gutierrez’s image comes down following Capitol invasion tweets.

item.title: Trump deletes tweets after being banned from Twitter [Updated]
item.description: Snapchat has also banned Trump’s account after insurrection at US Capitol.

item.title: DoJ says SolarWinds hackers breached its Office 365 system and read email
item.description: Department discovered the intrusion 9 days after SolarWinds hack came to light.

item.title: Why don’t PCs use error correcting RAM? “Because Intel,” says Linus
item.description: Artificial market segmentation may have suppressed demand for ECC in desktops.

item.title: Pro-Trump reporter gloats over access to fleeing Hill staffer’s computer
item.description: A violent mob invaded the US capitol building at the behest of Donald Trump.

item.title: Frontier agrees to fiber-network expansion in plan to exit bankruptcy
item.description: 350,000 homes and businesses in Calif. to get fiber after Frontier bankruptcy.

item.title: WhatsApp gives users an ultimatum: Share data with Facebook or stop using the app
item.description: The Facebook-owned messenger with 2 billion users revamps its privacy policy.

item.title: Ars readers gave a record $58,000 in 2020 Charity Drive
item.description: Readers have given nearly $400,000 to the EFF and Child’s Play since 2008.

item.title: Amazon promises $2B for affordable housing projects near its corporate offices
item.description: Arlington and Seattle are really expensive, and Amazon’s not making ‘em any cheaper.

item.title: Upcoming Apple privacy update has developers desperately seeking dodges
item.description: Developers look at invasive user tracking techniques before advertising rule change.

item.title: Study finds we’re already committed to more global warming—sort of
item.description: Accounting for spatial patterns ups the estimate, but details are crucial.

item.title: “Shkreli Award” goes to Moderna for “blatantly greedy” COVID vaccine prices
item.description: Moderna used $1 billion from feds to develop vaccine, then set some of the highest prices.

item.title: Last year reusable rockets entered the mainstream, and there’s no going back
item.description: “If Rocket Lab ever builds a new vehicle, it will fundamentally be reusable.”

item.title: Bucking Trump, NSA and FBI say Russia was “likely” behind SolarWinds hack
item.description: Trump has downplayed the mass compromise and Russia’s involvement. Underlings disagree.

item.title: In a parting gift, EPA finalizes rules to limit its use of science
item.description: On its way out, the Trump administration makes things harder for the next one.
